ch.obermuhlner.jhuge.collection.builder

Class AbstractHugeCollectionBuilder<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.obermuhlner.jhuge.collection.builder.AbstractHugeCollectionBuilder<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of the element in the Collection
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    CollectionBuilder<E>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractHugeListBuilder, AbstractHugeSetBuilder

    public abstract class AbstractHugeCollectionBuilder<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements CollectionBuilder<E>
    Abstract base class to implement a CollectionBuilder for a huge Collection.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractHugeCollectionBuilder()

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AbstractHugeCollectionBuilder<E> blockSize(int blockSize)
      Specifies the block size used in the MemoryMappedFileManager.

      Specifies the buffer size used in the MemoryMappedFileManager.
      AbstractHugeCollectionBuilder<E> capacity(int capacity)
      Specifies that the created huge collection should be initialized for the specified capacity.
      AbstractHugeCollectionBuilder<E> classLoader(java.lang.ClassLoader classLoader)
      Specifies the ClassLoader used to deserialize elements.
      AbstractHugeCollectionBuilder<E> element(java.lang.Class<E> elementClass)
      Specifies the type of the elements.
      AbstractHugeCollectionBuilder<E> element(Converter<E> elementConverter)
      Specifies the element Converter used to serialize/deserialize elements.
      AbstractHugeCollectionBuilder<E> faster()
      Specifies that the created huge collection is allowed to trade other resources (typically Java heap memory) to gain speed improvements.

      Returns the initial capacity.

      Returns the element Converter.

      Returns the MemoryManager.

      Returns whether the faster mode was specified in the builder.

      Specifies the MemoryManager used to store keys and values.

      • classLoader

        public AbstractHugeCollectionBuilder<E> classLoader(java.lang.ClassLoader classLoader)
        Specifies the ClassLoader used to deserialize elements.
        Parameters:
        classLoader - the ClassLoader used to deserialize elements
        Returns:
        this CollectionBuilder to chain calls
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called after adding the first element to this builder

      • element

        public AbstractHugeCollectionBuilder<E> element(java.lang.Class<E> elementClass)
        Specifies the type of the elements.

        If the ClassLoader is not explicitly specified then this class is used to determine the ClassLoader.

        If the element Converter is not explicitly specified then this class is used to determine the best key Converter.

        Parameters:
        elementClass - the type of the elements
        Returns:
        this CollectionBuilder to chain calls
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called after adding the first element to this builder

      • memoryManager

        public AbstractHugeCollectionBuilder<E> memoryManager(MemoryManager memoryManager)
        Specifies the MemoryManager used to store keys and values.

        This overrides any setting of bufferSize(int) and blockSize(int).

        Parameters:
        memoryManager - the MemoryManager to store the keys and values
        Returns:
        this CollectionBuilder to chain calls
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called after adding the first element to this builder

      • faster

        public AbstractHugeCollectionBuilder<E> faster()
        Specifies that the created huge collection is allowed to trade other resources (typically Java heap memory) to gain speed improvements.

        This is a hint and may or may not be ignored.

        Returns:
        this CollectionBuilder to chain calls

      • capacity

        public AbstractHugeCollectionBuilder<E> capacity(int capacity)
        Specifies that the created huge collection should be initialized for the specified capacity.

        This is a hint and may or may not be ignored.

        Parameters:
        capacity - the initial capacity
        Returns:
        this CollectionBuilder to chain calls
